body.p: The DC electrical system is energized by three 115/28-volt transformer-rectifier (TR) units rated at 75 amps. TR units 1 and 2 receive AC power from the transfer buses to power DC buses 1 and 2. TR units 1 and 2 are normally operated in parallel through circuit breakers and an isolation contactor. TR3, supplied by the 115V AC Transfer Bus No. 2, normally powers the Battery Bus and backs up TR units 1 and 2 through a diode.
